articles.title: Personalised AI models enhance support for children with ASD
articles.author: Gulf-Times
articles.summary: QF researchers found that AI models using eye-tracking are more effective than generalised approaches in understanding and supporting the unique attentional behaviours of children with autism. The findings highlight the importance of developing personalised learning methods rather than relying on one-size-fits-all solutions.

articles.title: Microsoft to cut up to 9,000 jobs as it invests in AI
articles.author: Lily Jamali
articles.summary: Microsoft confirms it will lay-off as many as 9,000 workers this year. The cuts would equate to 4% of Microsoft's 228,000 global workforce. Microsoft has initiated three other rounds of redundancies so far in 2025, including in May when it said it would axe 6,000 roles. More than 800 of the positions eliminated will be concentrated in Redmond and Bellevue. Microsoft is investing heavily in artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Reuters study: 44% of Indians are comfortable with AI-generated news
articles.author: Kausar Madhyia
articles.summary: Reuters Institute's Digital News Report 2025 is a comprehensive annual study that examines how news is consumed across 48 markets and six continents. People are choosing to consume news from social media platforms, podcasters, YouTubers, and TikTokers over traditional news media like TV, print and news websites.

articles.title: Location Bank announces groundbreaking white paper: The AI Disruption
articles.summary: Location Bank has released a white paper: The AI Disruption: Why search ads are losing ground and how local presence wins in the age of AI. The white paper highlights how the rise of AI-powered search engines, voice assistants, and generative search experiences (like Google's SGE) is diminishing the dominance of paid search ads.

articles.title: States retain power to regulate AI as Senate approves amendment led by Cantwell
articles.author: Lisa Stiffler
articles.summary: The U.S. Senate struck down a provision that would have banned states from regulating artificial intelligence for 10 years. The amendment was co-sponsored by Sen. Maria Cantwell, D-Wash., and Sen. Marsha Blackburn, R-Tenn. The original provision would have prohibited states from passing new AI laws or enforcing existing regulations on AI models and automated systems.

articles.title: AI can see whatever you want with US engineers' new attack technique
articles.author: Prabhat Ranjan Mishra
articles.summary: Engineers have developed a new method of attacking AI computer vision systems called RisingAttacK. They believe it can help them control what the AI 'sees' It is claimed to be effective at manipulating all the most widely used AI vision systems. They are widely used in autonomous vehicles, healthcare, and security technologies.

articles.title: Children's Health: Are AI chatbots safe for kids?
articles.author: Daily Herald
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) chatbots are now a part of daily life for many people. They include chatbots from Facebook, Google, Microsoft and others. For more information on AI chatbots visit: www.justgiving.com/chatsbots.

articles.title: Car Rental Company Facing Backlash After AI Scanner Gaffe
articles.author: Matt Wadleigh
articles.summary: Hertz uses a new AI scanner that automatically detects any scratches, dents or damages. Recently, a renter was upset after he returned his Thrifty rental car and was charged $440 for a one-inch scratch on the tire. The company claims that over 97% of cars scanned with the scanner show no billable damage.

articles.title: The new CEO flex: Bragging that AI handles exactly X% of the work

articles.summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff said in an interview that AI does up to 50% of all work at the company. In May, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella said 20% to 30% of the tech giant's code is now written by AI. In April, Google CEO Sundar Pichai said over 30%. The CEO flexes from Salesforce, Google, and Microsoft are difficult to know.

articles.title: The Prompt: Can Meta Hire Its Way To Superintelligence?

articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: The advent of sophisticated Artificial Intelligence (AI) is disrupting industries across the board. Next frontier for leadership is a human-centric one, according to Mr. Kann.  He believes that the future of leadership will be based on the human element.

articles.title: Silverback AI Chatbot Introduces Advanced AI Automation Feature to Streamline Customer Interactions

articles.summary: Silverback AI Chatbot has officially announced the launch of its AI Automation feature. It's designed to help businesses manage customer interactions more efficiently. It uses machine learning and natural language processing (NLP) to understand and respond to user input with contextual relevance. It can be used in both cloud-hosted and on-premises deployment models.

Nick Holeman, director of financial planning at Betterment, a digital advisory company, says AI isn't at the stage where it can be used for personalized financial advice. However, AI can be helpful for short-term savings and budgeting.

articles.title: reAlpha Enhances Mortgage Operations with AI-Powered Loan Officer Assistant
articles.author: re Alpha Tech Corp.
articles.summary: reAlpha Tech Corp. (Nasdaq: AIRE) has launched its AI-powered Internal Loan Officer Assistant. ReAlpha's recent acquisitions, including Be My Neighbor and GTG Financial, have expanded its mortgage services footprint across 30 U.S. states.

articles.title: AI Videos Of Black Women Displayed As 'Bigfoot Baddies' Go Viral For Racist Depictions
articles.author: Nahlah Abdur-Rahman
articles.summary: New AI videos of Black women depicted as bigfoot-human hybrids have become viral on social media. Since its launch in May, users have created videos of 'Bigfoot baddies' simulating real-life vlogs. The trend has emerged as an offensive display of stereotypes against Black women.

The next phase of research will focus on examining the internal workings of Centaur.

articles.title: Beyond Nvidia: 5 Lesser-Known AI Stocks Poised For Growth To Buy Now
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Looking beyond Nvidia, find lesser-known AI stocks poised for significant growth and find hidden gems to buy now for future returns. Find out more at: http://www.seekingalpha.com/investor/discussing-alternative-asset-stocks.

articles.title: Children's Health: Are AI chatbots safe for kids?
articles.author: Joanna Parga-Belinkie
articles.summary: Chatbots are AI-driven computer programs that listen to us and respond in friendly, human ways. Children and teens are increasingly turning to chatbots for entertainment or companionship. Chatbots don't have a sense of duty to protect kids and might give false, threatening, misleading, violent or overly sexual answers and advice to young users.

articles.summary: Francis Diaz Trevino, 81, was last seen at about 12:30 p.m. on Wednesday in the 3300 block of Janet Drive. She left on foot, headed north from her last known location. She has a cell phone, but it's turned off. TreVino is a cancer patient and is believed to be exhibiting signs of the onset of dementia.

AI's influence on everything from data via dining propositions to decision-making and dating resonates across the core facets of being human in a hybrid world. AI can be manipulated to manipulate our subconscious desires with commercial or political interests.

There is a debate in the sciences over when it is and is not appropriate to use chatbots for writing papers.

articles.title: G-Shock Came Up With a Productive Use for AI: Making Stronger Watches

articles.title: Commentary: AI isn't just standing by. It's doing things — without guardrails

Congress should turn the task force into a House Select Committee.

articles.title: Deutsche Telekom selects IBM Concert to accelerate IT processes with AI-powered automation
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: Deutsche Telekom will use IBM's AI-powered solution IBM Concert for its IT operations. It will reduce the number of steps in the patching process from 90 minutes to 20 minutes per instance. It also reduces the time to patch from 80 hours per critical vulnerabilities to 8 hours.

articles.title: AI-Powered 'Digital Workers' Deployed At Major Bank To Work Alongside Humans
articles.author: Tyler Durden via Zero Hedge
articles.summary: Bank of New York Mellon has deployed dozens of artificial intelligence-powered 'digital employees' that operate with human employees and have their own company login credentials. Goldman Sachs has already launched an internal AI assistant to 10,000 of its bankers, traders and asset managers to use.

articles.title: New ‘Mind-Reading' AI Predicts What Humans Will Do Next, And It's Shockingly Accurate
articles.author: Studyfinds Analysis
articles.summary: Scientists created an AI called Centaur that can predict human behavior across any psychological experiment with unprecedented accuracy. Centaur's internal workings became more aligned with human brain activity just by learning to predict our choices. The current version of the AI focuses on learning and decision-making with limited coverage. The team plans to expand their dataset to include more diverse populations.

articles.title: New Google AI makes robots smarter without the cloud
articles.author: Kurt Knutsson
articles.summary: Gemini Robotics On-Device is a new version of Google DeepMind's AI system that runs on the robot itself. It can understand natural language, perform fine motor tasks and generalize from very little data. It's designed for remote, security-sensitive, or infrastructure-poor settings.

articles.title: New Google AI makes robots smarter without the cloud
articles.author: Kurt Knutsson
articles.summary: Gemini Robotics On-Device is a new version of Google DeepMind's AI system that runs on the robot itself. It can understand natural language, perform fine motor tasks and generalize from very little data. It's designed for real-world, latency-sensitive environments with poor or no internet connectivity. Google is limiting access to select developers to study safety risks.

articles.title: Centaur: AI that thinks like us—and could help explain how we think
articles.author: Helmholtz Association
articles.summary: Researchers at Helmholtz Munich have developed an artificial intelligence model that can simulate human behavior with remarkable accuracy. The language model, called Centaur, was trained on more than ten million decisions from psychological experiments and makes decisions in ways that closely resemble those of real people. Potential applications range from analyzing classic psychological experiments to simulating individual decision-making processes in clinical contexts.

articles.title: Police apologize after using AI-altered photo to boast about Maine drug bust
articles.author: Mike Stunson
articles.summary: Westbrook Police Department in Maine shared a photo edited with artificial intelligence as it boasted about a recent drug bust. The department has since apologized, saying it did not realize parts of the image had been changed before it was shared online. Six people were charged in the drug bust, as authorities seized 61 grams of fentanyl and 23 grams of methamphetamine.

articles.title: Language app Babbel has a new CEO. Here's what he's learned about leading from day one

articles.summary: Tim Allen is the new CEO of Babbel, a language-learning company. He's been asking employees about the business instead of announcing his plans for the company immediately. He is taking over the reins from Markus Witte, who is now the company's executive chairman.

articles.summary: Alphabet stock ticked up 1% to $177.61 on Wednesday. The company is expected to report earnings for the quarter ended June 30 later this month. Google is by far the largest player in internet search and the advertising market that it facilitates. AI tools like Perplexity AI and OpenAI's ChatGPT have begun to hoover up web traffic that used to go through traditional search engines.

articles.author: Karen Weise

articles.summary: Penske Truck Leasing has a fleet of 433,000 for-lease vehicles. It uses AI to track and analyze data from different systems on board their trucks. The company collects 300 million data points daily and is on track to collect more than 100 billion data points this year.

Perona's team developed a new method to measure algorithmic bias in vision language models.
